Package scalf

Contains all of the classes created by Samuel Scalf.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Shapes
    A command line-driven program that calculates the area or volume of a two-dimensional or three-dimensional shape, respectively (See scalf.package1).
    ShapesGUI
    The ShapesGUI program loader.

Package scalf Description

Contains all of the classes created by Samuel Scalf.

The primary purpose of this package was to ensure there were no conflicts with other students' classes that may use the same names. The classes in this package were left at the "root" package level for ease of use.

Running a Program

Compiling

To compile a program, you must use the javac tool from the Java Development Kit (JDK) version 8 or later. In a command line interface or terminal, change the active directory to the location of the '.java' files. Next type "javac Program.java", replacing Program.java with the name of the program, like Shapes.java. Each of the classes located directly in this package are the main program files.

Example: javac ShapesGUI.java

Running

To run a program, after compiling, you just need to type java Program replacing @{code Program} with the name of the program, assuming the command line interface was not closed. If the command line interface or terminal was closed, open a new one and change the directory to the location of the (@code .java} files, as was done for compiling. Then enter java Program.

Example: java ShapesGUI

Changes

07 SEP 2020

  • Documentation now contains links and information for scalf.project2.
  • Updated information to include information on running and compiling the programs.
